title: Do not merge: Python release validation PR
body:
This PR is being used to trigger validation tests.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: Revert "[BEAM-4747] mkdirs if they don't exist in localfilesystem (#5903)
body:
This reverts commit d903dcfc7ff7300355688b08b779da880f15fe9d (PR #5903) because it causes release 2.7.0 RC2 validation to fail (the code does not deal well with relative paths).

This is a cherry-pick of #6494 into the release-2.7.0 branch.

**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here

------------------------

title: Go SDK avroio Package - Read/Write Avro Files
body:
Implemented an io package for reading/writing __avro__ files. This implementation borrows directly from the textio package, allowing it to support all the various read/write methodologies utilised in that package. I.e local storage, GCS, etc

_usage:_
```Go
package main

import (
	"context"
	"flag"
	"log"
	"reflect"

	"github.com/apache/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam"
	"github.com/apache/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam/x/beamx"
	"github.com/daidokoro/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam/io/avroio"
	"github.com/daidokoro/beam/sdks/go/pkg/beam/x/debug"
)

// Simple Avro Read Example - sample avro file provided

// Doc type used to unmarshal avro json data

type Doc struct {
	Stamp int64  `json:"timestamp"`
	Tweet string `json:"tweet"`
	User  string `json:"username"`
}

const schema = `{
	"type": "record",
	"name": "tweet",
	"namespace": "twitter",
	"fields": [
		{ "name": "timestamp", "type": "int" },
		{ "name": "tweet", "type": "string" },
		{ "name": "username", "type": "string" }
	]
}`

func main() {
	flag.Parse()
	beam.Init()

	ctx := context.Background()
	p := beam.NewPipeline()
	s := p.Root()

	rows := avroio.Read(s, "./twitter.avro", reflect.TypeOf(""))
	debug.Print(s, rows)

	docs := avroio.Read(s, "./twitter.avro", reflect.TypeOf(Doc{}))
	debug.Print(s, docs)

	format := beam.ParDo(s, func(d Doc, emit func(string)) {
		d.User = "daidokoro"
		d.Tweet = "I was here......"

		b, _ := json.Marshal(d)
		emit(string(b))
	}, docs)

	debug.Print(s, format)
	avroio.Write(s, "./out.avro", schema, format)

	if err := beamx.Run(context.Background(), p); err != nil {
		log.Fatalf(ctx, "Failed to execute job: %v", err)
	}
}

```

Example uses sample _twitter.avro_ file found [here](https://github.com/miguno/avro-cli-examples/blob/master/twitter.avro?raw=true)

 - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf).

It will help us expedite review of your Pull Request if you tag someone (e.g. `@username`) to look at it.

title: [BEAM-5487] ByteKeyRangeTracker restrictions do not cover the entire interval because of incorrect next key
body:
The definition of next for a byte key is incorrectly set as old key + 1 when treating the key as the next smallest value, for example:
0x01 is the next key for 0x00

The ByteKey compareTo operator treats two keys where one key is the proper prefix of the other as smaller hence 0x01 is greater then 0x00, but so is 0x0000 thus next is skipping over 0x0000 as the next smallest key larger then 0x00.

------------------------

title: [BEAM-5445] [BEAM-4796] [BEAM-3516] SpannerIO: Improve performance and documentation. Adds streaming support
body:
Rewrite the mechanism whereby SpannerIO handles writes.

1) Skip Unbatchable Mutations

Ranged Deletes and large mutations (by bytes or cells) are not batchable,
so skip the entire batching pipeline for them.

This adds a step which filters mutations into two streams: those which can be batched, which are then passed on to the existing (serialize/sample/assign Partition/group by parttion/batch) pipeline, and those which by definition can not be batched -- ranged delete operations, large mutation groups...

These are then merged into one stream (Flatten) and then written to Spanner.

2) Add option to wait for Schema to be ready to write

Current behavior waits for the entire input PCollection to be read and closed before reading the Schema. This can delay the pipeline for large inputs, and does not guarantee that the schema is ready (if it is created in the same pipeline) for small inputs.

It also breaks streaming mode completely as the input PCollection is never closed.

This PR adds an optional parameter with a PCollection to wait for before reading the schema. If not specified, the schema is read immediately.


3) Batch Mutations by bundle
Previously the entire input was scanned, assigned partitions and GroupByKey before writing. This required that the input was bounded, large amounts of disk space, and the entire input had to be read before any writes started.

With this change, the input is only sorted/batched over the current Bundle (or 1000x max batch size, whichever is smaller).

This has the following benefits: 

- Significantly decreases latency before the first row is written (down to a few seconds after the pipeline is started)
- Allows the SpannerIO writer to be used in a streaming pipeline
- Reduces the amount of worker disk space required for large sources
- Significantly improves the write speed for large sources

This PR also includes PR #6422 and #6409 

@chamikaramj

title: Remove standard_library.import_aliases() calls
body:
This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented [here](https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3).

This PR removes all `standard_library.import_aliases()` calls because its changes are too implicit. Especially since the `install_aliases()` call seems to also have effect on any modules imported from the module with the call.

It also seems like none of these calls were actually needed, but were added by the automatic conversion via the futurize tool.

@tvalentyn @Fematich @charlesccychen @aaltay

title: [BEAM-5446] SplittableDoFn: Remove "internal" methods for public API surface
body:
Note that this change modifies the @ProcessElement method to require users to use RestrictionTracker
instead of a concrete sub-type.

This change enables us to remove the synchronization requirement for users as we will
wrap the underlying restriction tracker allowing us to add appropriate synchronization as
needed and also to watch any calls that pass through the object such as the claim calls.

RestrictionTrackers was placed within sdks/java/fn-execution since watching claim observers will
be needed within the Java SDK harness in addition to the legacy implementation found in runners/core-java.

Eventually the code can be moved out of sdks/java/fn-execution and placed only within the SDK harness
itself once all pipelines run portably.

------------------------

title: [BEAM-5457] Auto-detect BigQuerySource(query=...) source location
body:
... among others. ## Issue - Running a pipeline with `BigQuerySource(query='...')` - Fails using DirectRunner: ``` Cannot read and write in different locations: source: EU, destination: US ``` - Works using DataflowRunner ## Cause
BigQueryWrapper.get_or_create_dataset seems to create the dataset in the US location when location is None, at least when running with DirectRunner: `BigQuerySource.__init__` sets `self.table_reference` to `None` if `query is not None`: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b33528b068e9a810eb4a720c3c6a6c63e6b04828/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L417-L430 `BigQueryReader._get_source_table_location` returns `None` if `self.source.table_reference` is `None` https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b33528b068e9a810eb4a720c3c6a6c63e6b04828/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L662-L677 `BigQueryWrapper.get_or_create_dataset` seems to create the dataset in the US location when location is `None`, at least when running with `DirectRunner`: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/b33528b068e9a810eb4a720c3c6a6c63e6b04828/sdks/python/apache_beam/io/gcp/bigquery.py#L877-L896
## Solution - ~Add a `location` init kwarg and attribute to `BigQuerySource` to allow specifying the location explicitly for query-source instances.~ - ~In `BigQueryReader._get_source_table_location`: Fall back to using `self.source.location` if `self.source.table_reference` is `None`.~ - Run the query using `dryRun=True` to get a list of referenced tables from the query, get the locations of all referenced tables and verify that they either are the same or that no tables were referenced. ------------------------ Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) title: [BEAM-5455] Log per-bundle messages at debug in python sdk

title: [BEAM-5434] Improve error handling in the artifact staging service
body:
While trying to debug an artifact staging problem, I encountered an
uncaught null pointer exception in the onCompleted method.  I also
decided to add log lines when errors are encountered, instead of
forwarding them to the client SDK.  This is because at present, some
client SDKs cannot be trusted to print the correct error message or
stack trace, leading to pain while debugging.

  * 4.10: https://docs.gradle.org/4.10/release-notes.html

Notable new features:
  * maven-publish is more powerful w.r.t. dependencies of auxiliary
    publications.
  * JavaExec can now take arguments from the command-line.
  * Improved incremental Java compiler

title: [BEAM-5319] Partially port runners
body:
This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented [here](https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3).

Fixing the tests for Python 3 requires a lot of cross-package fixes. I'm therefore submitting this PR with the failing tests skipped during Python 3 testing. This will allow us to build on these fixes while porting the other packages. Since the remaining errors might be caused by other packages, porting of these packages might already solve some of these errors.

In a later stage, these errors should be un-skipped and fixed if they are still failing.

@tvalentyn @Fematich @charlesccychen @aaltay

title: [BEAM-5288] Support environment pipeline option in Java and Python.
body:
* Adds java pipeline option for supplying custom environment.
* Update Flink to use the custom environment
Note this PR is build on top of https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/6373

The PR also consolidates environment type related functionality to a single file EnvironmentFactory. This requires a fair bit of refactoring and and code deletion (DockerJobBundleFactory, ProcessJobBundleFactory and related tests).

title: [BEAM-5144] Fix unstable test by ensuring acks are processed synchronously
body:
JmsIOTest was disabled as it was behaving erratically: testCheckpointMark was randomly failing with unexpected queue sizes. 

This would appear to be a consequence of the default ActiveMQ connection factory setting which sees acknowledgement messages sent and processed asynchronously. With this configuration it would be possible that an assertion against queue size could be performed before previous acknowledgements sent via a different connection had been processed.

The fix is a simple change to the connection URL query string, adding sendAcksAsync=false (http://activemq.apache.org/maven/apidocs/org/apache/activemq/ActiveMQConnectionFactory.html#isSendAcksAsync--) in order to ensure that acknowledgements are processed before subsequent test assertions.

@jbonofre 

Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-3089] Fix default values in FlinkPipelineOptions / Add tests
body:
[BEAM-3089] Use Flink cluster parallelism if no parallelism provided

- The Flink Runner didn't pick up the parallelism from the Flink command-line if
provided there.

- A warning is printed if the parallelism can't be inferred and we fall back to
  parallelism of 1 (which is also current behavior).

- Local tests can now also use a parallelism > 1 which might help for test coverage.

- Further, tests verify as much from the current behavior as possible.

- [BEAM-3089] Add test for FlinkExecutionEnvironments
- Revert default checkpointing mode to EXACTLY_ONCE
- Use default for checkpoint timeout
- [BEAM-3089] Test default values of FlinkPipelineOptions
- Set default master url to [auto]

title: [BEAM-5324] Partially port unpackaged modules to Python 3
body:
This is is part of a series of PRs with goal to make Apache Beam PY3 compatible. The proposal with the outlined approach has been documented [here](https://s.apache.org/beam-python-3).

Fixing the tests for Python 3 requires a lot of cross-package fixes. I'm therefore submitting this PR with the failing tests skipped during Python 3 testing. This will allow us to build on these fixes while porting the other packages. Since the remaining errors might be caused by other packages, porting of these packages might already solve some of these errors.

In a later stage, these errors should be un-skipped and fixed if they are still failing.

2 tests were skipped in this PR:
- test_side_input_tagged (apache_beam.pipeline_test.DoFnTest)
- test_side_input_no_tag (apache_beam.pipeline_test.DoFnTest)

@tvalentyn @Fematich @charlesccychen @aaltay

title: Skip batching pipeline for unbatchable mutations.
body:
Ranged Deletes and large mutations (by bytes or cells) are not batchable,
so skip the entire batching pipeline for them.

This adds a step which filters mutations into two streams: those which can be batched, which are then passed on to the existing (serialize/sample/assign Partition/group by parttion/batch) pipeline, and those which by definition can not be batched -- ranged delete operations, large mutation groups...

These are then merged into one stream (Flatten) and then written to Spanner.

------------------------
@chamikaramj

title: [BEAM-5411] Simplify BeamUnnest
body:
This simplifies BeamUnnest by moving most of the logic out into the conversion rule. This decouples the operation from our Calc implementation. This has the added benefit of failing on unsupported operations at planning time rather than execution time.

title: [BEAM-4796] SpannerIO: Add option to wait for Schema to be ready.
body:
Current behavior waits for the entire input PCollection to be read
and closed before reading the Schema. This can delay the pipeline
for large inputs, and does not guarantee that the schema is ready
(if it is created in the same pipeline) for small inputs.

It also breaks streaming mode completely as the input PCollection
is never closed. 

This PR adds an optional parameter with a PCollection to wait for
before reading the schema. If not specified, the schema is read
immediately.

This provides a partial -- but not complete -- fix for streaming mode (there are still issues with the partitioning/grouping in streaming mode which means that NPE's will be thrown with more than trivial load).

@chamikaramj

title: [BEAM-5404] Use Java serialization for MutationGroup objects.
body:
The Cloud Spanner connector uses a custom serialization system for MutationGroup objects

Java serialization is much more efficient than the custom serialization
system used by MutationGroupEncode -- in both speed, and space: the
encoded byte arrays are 1/10th of the size.

This PR replaces the custom serialization with a simple Java serialization using the Beam SerializableCoder class.

@chamikaramj

title: [BEAM-3286] Add Dataflow support for side input
body:
It turns out that Dataflow sometimes replaces the main input key with, say, "-23", when it mucks with the graph. We also used the wrong key for side input.

Needs an updated runner harness before we can enable side input integration tests.

------------------------

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:
